radios.title: shmuFM

radio_info.short: Station House Media Unit (shmu), established as a charity in 2003, is one of the core cultural organisations in Aberdeen, and is at the forefront
radio_info.rest:
of Community Media development in Scotland, supporting residents in the seven regeneration areas of the city in radio and video production, traditional and on-line publications, music production and digital inclusion. The organisation also supports other disadvantaged communities, both geographic and communities of interest, with an employability and training arm and a programme for offenders, both pre and post-release.

*shmuFM* broadcasts a variety of issue-based, music and community radio programming on 99.8FM. Volunteers and partner organisations from the regeneration areas are offered full training & support in order to produce and present their own radio programmes.

------
Shows: Go With The Flow, Youth Radio Project, Bring That Beat Back, Cruise Control Radio, A Little Bit Of Us, Aber Dabba Doo, Allie Ambient Sound Soul System, Americana, Around With A Ranger, Aye Gallus, Barry Deakin Sounds, Bits And Pieces, Broon And Bates, Cheese On Crackers, Cumming North, Destination Venus, Dialogue Youth, DJ SONBAR, Family Learning Show, Getting To Folk, Happy Hour, Indian Beats, Lock Stock & 2 Non Smoking, Lynsey's Musical Cascade, Middlefield Matters, Muso Confuso, My Beautiful Self, Packed Lunch, Positive Slant, Prole Art Threat, Radio Cowboy, Radio Skool, Seaton Speaks, shmuFM MOIN, Sniadanie Po Polsku, Take A Moment, Tez & Finnie, The Breakfast Show, The Early Morning Wake Up Call, The Essential Collection, The Fog, The Friday Burn Up, The Health Show, The Monday Session, The Money Show, The Reading Bus, The Weekend Party Hour, The Weekend Starts Here, Tilly Talks, Ultimate Local Sensations, Up The Creek, Wall Of Sound, Woman's Hour, Woodside On Wednesday

radios.title: Awaz FM

radio_info.short: Awaz FM serves the Asian and African population in Glasgow, broadcasting in English, Urdu, Punjabi, Hindi, Paharhi and Swahili delivering entertainment, news local, national and
radio_info.rest:
community information. It also covers particular faiths - Christianity, Hinduism, Sikhism and Islam. We celebrate the various religious days including Christmas, Easter, Navratri, Holi, Ramadhan, all the Guru holy days, Nigar Kirten, Diwali and Milad Nabi.

Awaz FM is a Community Radio Station setup as part of a year long license in 2001 and on August 7th 2001, we were invited by the Radio Authority (Ofcom) to apply for the PILOT License Scheme. On April 15th 2002 we started our technical tests and went live on Air Monday 29th April 2002 for one full year.

Awaz FM works with many organisations including Glasgow City Council, Greater Glasgow Health Board, Community Planning Partnership, Strathclyde Police, Fire Brigade, Scottish Goverment, Cemvo, Gara and West of Scotland Racial Equality Council in delivering their services tot he Asian and African Community.

Awaz FM also enables many community organisations and individuals to use the station as a platform to highlight their work and services.

Awaz FM is the only media platform where information and services can be delivered in a multilingual format.

History of Awaz FM:

Founded in 1996 by Javed Sattar

First came On-Air in September 15th 1997

Radio Awaz joined forces with Bubble FM and Radio Sangeet in 2001 to become Awaz FM

Awaz FM in 2002 awarded Pilot Licence and started test transmission in April 15th 2002

Live On-Air on April 29th 2002 - Javaid Ullah was the breakfast presenter waking up Glasgow to the majical sounds of Awaz FM

Awaz FM achieved its fulltime 5 year licence from Ofcom in January 2005

Awaz FM is also committed to giving something back to Glasgow and every year it raises money for local charities. In the past we have rasided money for Yorkhill Hospital, MacMillan Cancer, Apna Service Barnados. Some of the team have climbed Kilimanjaro and treked Great Wall of China. If you would like to be involved please contact info@awazfm.co.uk

MISSION STATEMENT

Awaz FM serves the Asian and African community in Glasgow, delivering entertainment, community information, local, national and international news broadcasting in Urdu, Punjabi, Hindi, Swahili and English.

Awaz translates as voice in Urdu and Hindi languages.

Awaz FM is the voice of Glasgows BME communities and their respective faiths. A voice to let the people of Glasgow express their needs and desires. It provides organisations an opportunity to use Awaz FM as a platform to deliver their aims and objectives.

Awaz FM has established itself as the only media platform since 1997 to be serving the BME Community of Glasgow.

------
Shows: Weekend Warmup, Africa Live, An Evening with Preet, Apna Punjab, Awaz De Kahan Hai, AWAZ FM Chart Show, AWAZ FM Friday Breakfast Show, Awaz FM Monday Breakfast Show, Awaz FM Monday Night, AWAZ FM Saturday Late Breakfast, AWAZ FM Thursday Breakfast Show, Awaz FM Tuesday Breakfast Show, Awaz FM Wednesday Breakfast Show, Awazey Masiha, Baaton Baaton Main, Bhooli Bisri Yaadin, Bila Takalluf, Bollywood Masti, Des Praya Apne Lok, Desi Fusion, Dhanak Rang, Dil Lagi, Drivetime, Hungama, Itwar Khushghawar, Juma, Kathiya Mithiya Gallan, Lollywood Dhamaka, Manoranjan, Mehfil Mitran De, Mehk, Meri Pasand, Music Through The Night, Naat Program, Naya Savera, Punjabi Show, Punjabi with Dilber, Rangla Punjab, Ru Ba Ru, Sanatan Dharam Chaupal, Sandese Aate Hain, Sangeetmala, Sapney, Sunday Scratch, Sunday Sizlers, Sur Punjab De, Sur Sangeet, Wots Up, Yaadon Ke Phool

radio_info.short: "SubCity was a magical world of stuffy studios, tangled cables, loud, late-night dance music and unrivalled creativity." - Dougal Perman, Programme Director - Inner Ear
radio_info.rest:
Ltd (home to Radio Magnetic)

Subcity Radio is the radio station based at University of Glasgow, which for the last 16 years has been pushing the boundaries of student radio in all respects. Unlike most other student stations, Subcity has always been aimed squarely at music lovers. With no set playlist and 90% specialist programming, it has consistently provided a service unavailable anywhere else in Glasgow.

Subcity covers almost every musical base, including Motown, Drum and Bass, Synthpop, Jazz and Techno with interesting and engaging presenters providing information on the music they play. The station broadcasts online all year round and annually on FM. Listen.

Subcity has a long history as one of the staples of the Glasgow club scene. Their events attract major attention from the press and have launched the careers of some of the cities biggest DJs including; Optimo, Freakmenoovers, Mixed Business and Mish Mash.

Subcity provides a connection with the Glasgow music community, whether through its programming, events or through the forums where listeners go to find out what's fresh on the Glasgow music scene straight from the source - from underground parties to the latest releases from your favourite artists and labels.

All Subcity content is independently produced by contributors who have an active interest in the station. No matter what the style is, from geeky music shows to whimsical chat, as long as it is interesting and engaging it can make it onto the Subcity schedule.

For more information on the station's history, check out Subcity on Wikipedia.
